frame.name: Purpose
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> wants to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>, or an object. A <fen>Means</fen> has been created or is used to allow the creator or a user to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>. The <fen>Goal</fen> is a state of the world that does not currently hold but which the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to realize and is planning and/or working towards. In some cases, it is difficult to decide whether a noun phrase metonymically stands for the <fen>Agent</fen> or the <fen>Means</fen> (e.g. The goal [of this paper/seminar/project] is to determine ...). We mark these phrases as <fen>Agent</fen> on the first layer but also annotate them as <fen>Means</fen> on a second annotation layer.
In some cases a <fen>Restrictor</fen> on the <fen>Goal</fen> state of affairs can be given prominence as a separate constituent. Talking about <fen>Goal</fen>s frequently includes the mention of a <fen>Domain</fen> to which the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Goal</fen> is relevant.
<ex>The modest <fex name="Agent">American</fex> <t>goal</t> <fex name="Goal">of a threefold increase in capacity</fex> recognises this fact .</ex> <ex>The <t>object</t> <fex name="Means">of the tutorial</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="Goal">to help a student concentrate on his writing skills</fex> </ex> <ex> The prime <t>goal</t> <fex name="Means">of the programme</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="Goal">to help develop processes of scientific thinking in children</fex> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">My</fex> <t>goal</t> <fex name="Means">in this book</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="Goal">to introduce the reader to Web programming applications</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">The president's</fex> <fex name="Domain">economic</fex> <t>goal</t> <fex name="Restrictor">for the country </fex><m>was</m> <fex name="Goal">to overcome the recession</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The volitional actor who intends to achieve a goal. <ex> <fex name="Agent">Microsoft 's</fex> <t>goal</t> of delivering a million copies in the first year is trifling compared to the 25 million copies of Windows it has shipped since May 1990.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action or state of affairs that the Agent wants to achieve.
<ex>The company missed its <t>goal</t> <fex name="Goal">of getting a thousand third-party software packages shipped</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Means</fen> is an object or action that is used or designed to achieve a particular <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex> The <t>goal</t> <fex name="Means">of treatment</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="Goal">to lower diastolic blood pressure below 85 mm Hg</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>This frame element expresses a sphere of activity within which an <fen>Agent</fen> has a <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex>His <fex name="Domain">political</fex> <t>goal</t> is the restoration of the monarchy</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element expresses a time period during which an <fen>Agent</fen> had a particular <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex>But the main <t>goal</t> <fex name="Time">of the 1990s</fex> could be to transform a big , heavily armed standing army into a more flexible force </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Restrictor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate a spatial or temporal or individual framework relative to which the <fen>Goal</fen> is said to hold. More than one <fen>Restrictor</fen> can be mentioned.
<ex>Our <t>goal</t> <fex name="Restrictor">for Japan</fex> <fex name="Restrictor">for next year</fex>is to sell 2000 units</ex> <ex>Our sales <t>target</t> <fex name="Restrictor">for that week</fex> was 200 units</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Attribute
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate an <fen>Attribute</fen> for which it is the <fen>Agent</fen>'s goal that it have or reach a particular <fen>Value</fen> .
<ex>We exceeded our <fex name="Attribute">production</fex> <t>target</t> of 2000 units</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Value
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate which <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Agent</fen> wants the <fen>Attribute</fen> to reach.
<ex>GM has a production <t>target</t> <fex name="Value">of 2,000,000 units</fex></ex></def-root>
